articles.author: Yukun Zhang, Jing Xu, Lewis Jackson
articles.description: China called for all "unilateral" U.S. tariffs to be cancelled on Thursday, as signs emerged that the Trump administration may de-escalate its trade war with Beijing.
articles.title: China pushes for tariff cancellation to end US trade war

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: India has summoned the top Pakistani diplomat in New Delhi, local media reported on Thursday, a day after it announced measures to downgrade ties with Islamabad as relations between the nuclear-armed rivals plummeted following a deadly militant attack in Kashmir.
articles.title: India calls all-party meet, summons top Pakistani diplomat after Kashmir attack on tourists

articles.author: Tim Cocks, Nellie Peyton, Ted Hesson, Kristina Cooke
articles.description: U.S. officials have interviewed white South Africans seeking refugee status about their troubles with land disputes, crime and perceived racism, while refugees from other countries are being deported or barred from the United States.
articles.title: US focuses on persecution claims as white South Africans seek resettlement

articles.author: Luc Cohen
articles.description: President Donald Trump's administration moved a Venezuelan man who had worked in construction in Philadelphia to Texas for possible deportation after a federal judge had issued an order blocking his removal from Pennsylvania or the United States, according to court records.
articles.title: Exclusive: Trump administration moved Venezuelan to Texas for possible deportation despite judge's order

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: An overnight Russian combined missile and drone attack triggered fires, smashed buildings and buried residents under rubble in the Ukrainian capital Kyiv, killing nine people and injuring more than 70, the State Emergency Service said on Thursday.
articles.title: Drone, missile attack on Kyiv kills nine, injures more than 70, says State Emergency Service

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia and Ukraine traded new barbs over faltering peace efforts on Thursday, with Moscow accusing Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy of blocking diplomacy and Kyiv saying Russian President Vladimir Putin wanted the war to continue.
articles.title: Russia and Ukraine trade blame over faltering peace moves

articles.author: Joshua McElwee
articles.description: St. Peter's Basilica reopened its doors, after a brief pause in the early hours of the day, to welcome thousands of worshippers from around the world who want to pay their final respects to Pope Francis.
articles.title: St. Peter's Basilica reopens to faithful bidding farewell to pope

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: An Israeli airstrike hit a police station in Jabalia in the northern Gaza Strip on Thursday, killing at least 10 people, local health authorities said, and Israel's military said it had struck a command centre of Hamas and the Islamic Jihad groups.
articles.title: Israeli fire kills at least 26 people in Gaza, hits a police station

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Britain on Thursday said it was banning the export to Russia of video game controllers which can be used to pilot drones, part of its latest package of trade measures following Moscow's invasion of Ukraine.
articles.title: UK blocks video game controller exports to Russia, seeking to thwart drone pilots

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: South Korean prosecutors have indicted former president Moon Jae-in for alleged bribery, a prosecution office spokesperson said on Thursday.
articles.title: South Korea prosecutors indict ex-president Moon Jae-in for bribery
